Hi, We are getting this error message on one of our customer integrations :
"This oauth-token (XXX) does not have proper permissions! (requires any of [design-manager-access])"
The account was working fine before, but is throwing this error now, while trying to create "Email Template" on HubSpot. OAuth token has access to the following scopes "content", "contact" and "OAuth".
Hey there - you need to go into your settings for your app( whatever account you registered your app on that gave you your redirect url ) and just add design manager access

Hey folks - has anyone had experience pulling templates from HubSpot? It returns a value that is numerical such as "2" or "20" - wondering if anyone has created a table that maps the number with the actual type i.e. 2 = "HTML" 20 = "CSS" -- something like that.
I also have a question about SSO and authenticating users that connect our app to HubSpot: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/HubSpot-SSO-and-forcing-sign-on-again/m-p/433638#M43025>

This isn’t something we’ve exposed. It’s a sensitive topic though I can definitely see how it can be useful. Right now the best way to handle these cases is to request what scopes you need in the `optional_scopes` param during the OAuth connection and see which ones you actually get
I think the property you might be looking for is `hs_discount_percentage` try that one and see if it has the expected result
